unnormalised: Reports suggest that a recent mix-up at the "Healthy Hearts" clinic in Gurgaon led to some...interesting results. Apparently, someone thought cc stood for "chai cups" instead of cubic centimeters. So, patients expecting a 5cc dose of cough syrup got enough to fill a small swimming pool – roughly 500 chai cups!
normalised: Reports suggest that a recent mix-up at the "Healthy Hearts" clinic in Gurgaon led to some...interesting results. Apparently, someone thought c c stood for "chai cups" instead of cubic centimeters. So, patients expecting a five c c dose of cough syrup got enough to fill a small swimming pool – roughly five hundred chai cups!

unnormalised: The clinic is saying it was a simple "clerical error," but patients are reporting some…unusual side effects. One elderly gentleman claims he can now cough with the force of a small hurricane, reaching a velocity of approximately 100km/hr. Another says he’s measuring his daily water intake in liters, because anything less seems…underwhelming now.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, the clinic's head, insists everything is under control. "It's just a slight overestimation of dosage," she said, trying to hide a giggle. "Besides, all that extra cough syrup probably cleared out everyone's sinuses real good! Think of it as a free nasal irrigation, only five thousand milliliter at a time!"

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, the clinic's head, insists everything is under control. "It's just a slight overestimation of dosage," she said, trying to hide a giggle. "Besides, all that extra cough syrup probably cleared out everyone's sinuses real good! Think of it as a free nasal irrigation, only 5000 mL at a time!"
normalised: The health ministry is "investigating" the situation. Meanwhile, local pharmacies are reporting a massive spike in sales of antacids. Perhaps everyone's just trying to prepare for the inevitable tsunami of coughs to come. Stay tuned for more updates, folks! And maybe double-check your dosages next time. Just a thought.
